page.title: 01Down Ampney & Latton
page.content: This block situated on the Wiltshire/Gloucestershire boarder is primarily farmland, containing two small villages, Down Ampney & Latton. The farmland is almost entirely cereal production, with a small livestock industry. Both villages have a mix of agricultural, council & private houses, most villagers commute to the larger towns near by for employment, via, the A419 which runs diagonally through the SW quarter of the block, this being a single carrageway main road, linking the M4 & M5 motorways. This dangerous road, due to the speed volume and type of traffic, effectively segregates the south west corner of the block, distroying what should be the rural character of Laton. Little remains of the disused airfield SE of Down Ampney, other than a small menorial to the Arnham landing
